newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan notebook PC, scanner shares up on outlook.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan notebook PC, scanner shares up on outlook.

text.p: Taiwan's notebook computer and scanner makers surged at mid-morning on Thursday on expectations sound sales and profit performance starting from the second quarter, brokers said.
Notebook computer maker Compal Electronics was up T$4.5 or 4.98 percent to T$95 and scanner maker Umax Data Systems had surged T$11 or 5.5 percent to T$211.
The overall index was up 1.25 percent.
"Observing the recent trend, we expect notebook computer and scanner makers to enjoy record-high sales and profit performance starting from April," said HSBC James Capel analyst Alex Chen.
"We recommend 'buy' for such shares, which should outperform other electronics shares," he said.
